comments.author: palladia
comments.body: @andschwa Help!  Any idea why my builds all fail?  I have even started from scratch and re-cloned.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: According to the log, the commit you set the monad submodule to does not exist in that repository on GitHub.

comments.author: palladia
comments.body: OK, I pushed the monad branch up again. Is there anyway to force a rebuild without a new push in this PR?

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
If the commit in this branch didn't build, you would need to push a commit
that builds. If it's a transient network error, you can manually restart a
build using the button on the build's page, but I don't think that's what
you're running into.
On Feb 9, 2016 9:34 AM, "George Fleming" notifications@github.com wrote:

> OK, I pushed the monad branch up again. Is there anyway to force a rebuild
> without a new push in this PR?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/pull/518#issuecomment-181973002
> .

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: I don't think you want this PR, it doesn't have your tests.

comments.author: palladia
comments.body: As I explained in other PR, can do I tests in a separate PR?
